intro: Bunium fontanesii, commonly known as the alpine fennel, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Bunium fontanesii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
